metadata.prompt_optimization: Optimized V2.0 November 7, 2025 - Added CAN-25, renumbered 1-25, enhanced flagging guidance

compositions.prompt_text: Show me my pending invitations and which ones I should prioritize based on my priorities for this week: customer meetings and product strategy.

execution_plan.description: Parse the user prompt to extract intent: show pending invitations and prioritize based on weekly priorities (customer meetings and product strategy). Identify constraints: timeframe = this week, priorities = customer meetings and product strategy.
execution_plan.note: Universal first step to interpret natural language and extract actionable constraints.

execution_plan.description: Retrieve all calendar events and invitations for the current week from the user's calendar.
execution_plan.note: Required to get the set of events to analyze.

execution_plan.description: Extract RSVP status and other metadata from retrieved events to identify pending invitations.
execution_plan.note: Needed to filter for pending invitations and access details for prioritization.

execution_plan.description: Classify each pending invitation by meeting type (e.g., customer meeting, product strategy, internal sync).
execution_plan.note: Supports prioritization by identifying which meetings are customer-related or product strategy.

execution_plan.description: Assess the importance of each pending invitation based on user priorities (customer meetings and product strategy) and contextual factors.
execution_plan.note: Ranks pending invitations according to strategic importance.

parallelization_opportunities: step 4 and step 5 can run in parallel after step 3
orchestration.error_handling: If metadata extraction fails, fallback to basic event info; if classification fails, return unclassified list with RSVP status.

compositions.prompt_text: I have some important meetings coming up. Help me track all my important meetings this week and flag any that require focus time to prepare for them.

execution_plan.description: Parse the user prompt to extract intent: identify that the user wants to track important meetings for this week and flag those requiring preparation time.
execution_plan.note: Universal first step to interpret natural language and derive actionable constraints.

execution_plan.description: Retrieve all calendar events for the current week to identify which meetings are scheduled.
execution_plan.note: Needed to get the raw set of meetings for this week.

execution_plan.description: Extract metadata for each meeting such as attendees, RSVP status, attachments, and notes to support preparation time analysis and flagging.
execution_plan.note: Provides details required for downstream tasks like prep time estimation and annotation.

execution_plan.description: Classify each meeting by type (e.g., 1:1, team sync, client meeting) to help contextualize importance and preparation needs.
execution_plan.note: Objective classification to support prioritization and context.

execution_plan.description: Assess the strategic importance and priority of each meeting to identify which ones are considered 'important' by the user.
execution_plan.note: Subjective evaluation to filter important meetings as requested.

execution_plan.description: Estimate preparation time required for each meeting based on complexity, attachments, and agenda details.
execution_plan.note: Determines which meetings require focus time for preparation.

execution_plan.description: Flag meetings that require preparation time so the user can easily identify them.
execution_plan.note: Adds visual indicators or tags to meetings that need prep time.

parallelization_opportunities: step 4 and step 5 can run in parallel after step 3
orchestration.error_handling: If metadata extraction fails, fallback to basic event info; if prep time analysis fails, still return important meetings without flags.

compositions.prompt_text: Help me understand where I am spending my time across different types of meetings and suggest ways I might reclaim time for my top priorities.

execution_plan.description: Parse the user prompt to extract intent: analyze time allocation across meeting types and suggest ways to reclaim time for top priorities.
execution_plan.note: Universal first step to interpret natural language and identify goals.

execution_plan.description: Retrieve all calendar events for the relevant timeframe (e.g., past month) to analyze time distribution.
execution_plan.note: Needed to access raw meeting data for analysis.

execution_plan.description: Extract metadata such as attendees, duration, and meeting details from retrieved events to support classification and analysis.
execution_plan.note: Provides foundational details for subsequent classification and analysis.

execution_plan.description: Classify each meeting into types (1:1, team sync, customer, etc.) to understand time allocation by category.
execution_plan.note: Essential for breaking down time spent across different meeting types.

execution_plan.description: Assess the strategic importance and priority of each meeting to identify which ones align with top priorities.
execution_plan.note: Determines which meetings are critical versus low-value for the user.

execution_plan.description: Aggregate time spent by meeting type and importance to quantify where time is being allocated.
execution_plan.note: Provides the core analysis of time distribution across meeting categories.

execution_plan.description: Generate visual charts or summaries showing time spent by meeting type and importance for easy interpretation.
execution_plan.note: Helps the user quickly understand patterns and trends in meeting time allocation.

execution_plan.description: Suggest actionable ways to reclaim time, such as reducing low-priority meetings or consolidating similar sessions.
execution_plan.note: Delivers personalized strategies to align calendar usage with top priorities.

parallelization_opportunities: Steps 4 and 5 could partially overlap after metadata extraction, but typically run sequentially for dependency clarity.
orchestration.error_handling: If visualization fails, still provide textual breakdown and recommendations; retry retrieval and classification on transient errors.

compositions.prompt_text: Set up a weekly 30-minute 1:1 with {name}. I'd prefer afternoons and want to avoid Fridays. Automatically reschedule on declines or conflicts.

execution_plan.description: Parse the user prompt to extract intent (schedule recurring meeting), constraints (weekly, 30 minutes, afternoons, avoid Fridays), attendee ({name}), and special instructions (auto-reschedule on declines/conflicts).
execution_plan.note: Universal first step to interpret natural language and extract structured data.

execution_plan.description: Resolve the provided attendee name to a directory entry or contact object to ensure correct scheduling.
execution_plan.note: Needed to identify the correct person for the 1:1 meeting.

execution_plan.description: Retrieve the user's and attendee's calendar events to check availability and avoid conflicts.
execution_plan.note: Required before checking availability and scheduling.

execution_plan.description: Check both parties' calendars for common free slots in afternoons, excluding Fridays, for a 30-minute window.
execution_plan.note: Ensures the meeting is scheduled at a mutually available time respecting user preferences.

execution_plan.description: Generate an RRULE for a weekly recurring meeting based on user constraints.
execution_plan.note: Needed to set up the meeting as a recurring weekly event.

execution_plan.description: Apply optimization to select the best recurring slot that satisfies all constraints (afternoons, avoid Fridays, 30 min).
execution_plan.note: Ensures the chosen time slot meets all user preferences.

execution_plan.description: Enable automatic rescheduling logic to handle declines or future conflicts for this recurring meeting.
execution_plan.note: Implements the user's request to auto-reschedule when conflicts or declines occur.

parallelization_opportunities: Steps 3 and 5 could partially overlap after constraints are known, but generally sequential for dependency integrity.
orchestration.error_handling: If attendee resolution fails, prompt user for clarification. If no slots found, suggest relaxing constraints. Retry rescheduling logic on transient errors.

compositions.prompt_text: I need to clear my schedule for Thursday afternoon to focus on our product review. Help me reschedule or decline those meetings so I have dedicated time to prepare.

execution_plan.description: Parse the user prompt to extract intent (clear Thursday afternoon), constraints (Thursday afternoon timeframe), and actions (reschedule or decline meetings, create prep time).
execution_plan.note: Universal first step to interpret natural language and derive scheduling constraints.

execution_plan.description: Retrieve all calendar events scheduled for Thursday afternoon to identify which meetings need to be cleared.
Extract metadata for Thursday afternoon meetings including RSVP status, attendees, and logistics to determine which can be declined or rescheduled.
execution_plan.note: Enables subsequent tasks like RSVP updates and prep time analysis.

execution_plan.description: Classify each meeting by type (e.g., 1:1, team sync, customer) to help decide which meetings are easier to reschedule or decline.
Assess the strategic importance and urgency of each meeting to prioritize which ones to keep, reschedule, or decline.
execution_plan.note: Runs in parallel with classification for efficiency.

execution_plan.description: Estimate the amount of preparation time needed for the product review and ensure enough focus time is created by clearing meetings.
Formulate and solve scheduling constraints to free up Thursday afternoon while minimizing disruption to important meetings.
Automatically reschedule lower-priority meetings to alternative time slots based on the rescheduling plan.
execution_plan.note: Executes the actual rescheduling of meetings.

execution_plan.description: Decline meetings that cannot be rescheduled and update RSVP status accordingly.

parallelization_opportunities: step 4 and step 5 can run in parallel after metadata extraction
orchestration.error_handling: Retry failed retrieval or rescheduling steps; if auto-rescheduling fails, suggest manual options.

compositions.prompt_text: Find a time in the next two weeks for a 1 hour meeting with Chris, Sangya, and Kat. We need to work around Kat's schedule since she's traveling. Make the meeting in person and add a room.

execution_plan.description: Parse the user prompt to extract intent (schedule a new meeting), constraints (next two weeks, 1 hour duration, attendees: Chris, Sangya, Kat, in-person, add a room), and special conditions (work around Kat's travel schedule).
execution_plan.note: Universal first step to interpret natural language and extract structured requirements.

execution_plan.description: Resolve Chris, Sangya, and Kat to their directory entries or email addresses to ensure accurate calendar lookups.
execution_plan.note: Needed to identify correct calendars for availability checks.

execution_plan.description: Retrieve calendar events for the next two weeks for the user and all resolved attendees to check availability and Kat's travel schedule.
execution_plan.note: Provides the data needed for availability and constraint satisfaction.

execution_plan.description: Extract metadata from retrieved events such as locations, travel blocks, and existing commitments to understand Kat's travel schedule and in-person feasibility.
execution_plan.note: Enables understanding of travel constraints and room requirements.

execution_plan.description: Check free/busy status for all attendees within the next two weeks to find common available slots for a 1-hour meeting.
execution_plan.note: Identifies potential time slots for the meeting.

execution_plan.description: Apply constraints such as working around Kat's travel schedule, ensuring the meeting is in-person, and fitting within the next two weeks for 1 hour.
execution_plan.note: Selects the best time slot that satisfies all user-specified conditions.

execution_plan.description: Book an appropriate meeting room for the selected time slot to fulfill the in-person requirement.
execution_plan.note: Ensures the meeting has a physical location reserved.

parallelization_opportunities: Steps 3 and 4 could partially overlap after initial retrieval, but generally sequential for dependency integrity.
orchestration.error_handling: If room booking fails, suggest alternative rooms or convert to virtual; if attendee resolution fails, prompt user for clarification.

compositions.prompt_text: Help me set the agenda to review the progress of Project Alpha. I want to get confirmation we are on track and discuss any blocking issues or risks.

execution_plan.description: Parse the user prompt to extract intent (set agenda), key entities (Project Alpha), and objectives (review progress, confirm on track, discuss blocking issues and risks).
execution_plan.note: Universal first step to interpret natural language and derive actionable constraints.

execution_plan.description: Retrieve upcoming meetings related to Project Alpha to identify the correct meeting for agenda setting.
Extract metadata from the identified Project Alpha meeting such as attendees, existing agenda notes, and logistics to inform agenda creation.
execution_plan.note: Needed to understand meeting details before generating agenda.

execution_plan.description: Analyze historical meeting notes and context to anticipate potential risks or blockers that should be included in the discussion.
execution_plan.note: Supports the user's request to discuss blocking issues or risks.

execution_plan.description: Generate a structured agenda for the Project Alpha meeting including sections for progress review, confirmation of status, and discussion of risks/blockers.
execution_plan.note: Directly addresses the user's request to set the agenda.

parallelization_opportunities: step 4 (risk anticipation) can run in parallel after metadata extraction while preparing agenda inputs
orchestration.error_handling: If risk anticipation fails, proceed with agenda generation using available objectives and metadata.

compositions.prompt_text: I have a meeting with senior leadership tomorrow. Find the most recent meeting with them and summarize the topics into 3 discussion points. Generate any objections or concerns that might come up and give me effective responses.

execution_plan.description: Parse the user prompt to extract intent: find the most recent meeting with senior leadership, summarize topics into 3 discussion points, and generate objections with responses.
execution_plan.note: Universal first step to interpret natural language and identify constraints like 'senior leadership', 'most recent meeting', and 'summarize topics'.

execution_plan.description: Retrieve user's calendar events, focusing on past meetings with senior leadership to identify the most recent one.
execution_plan.note: Needed to access historical meeting data for senior leadership.

execution_plan.description: Extract metadata from retrieved events, including attendees, meeting notes, and any attached documents to confirm senior leadership presence and gather discussion content.
execution_plan.note: Enables identification of the correct meeting and provides content for summarization.

execution_plan.description: Resolve 'senior leadership' to actual attendee names and verify their presence in the meeting.
execution_plan.note: Ensures accurate filtering of meetings involving senior leadership.

execution_plan.description: Generate a concise summary of the most recent senior leadership meeting, condensing topics into 3 clear discussion points.
execution_plan.note: Fulfills the requirement to summarize topics into 3 discussion points.

execution_plan.description: Analyze previous meeting content to anticipate potential objections or concerns that might arise in the upcoming meeting.
execution_plan.note: Addresses the user's request to generate possible objections or concerns.

execution_plan.description: Generate effective responses to each anticipated objection, formatted for easy reference.
execution_plan.note: Completes the user's request by providing actionable responses to anticipated objections.

parallelization_opportunities: Steps 6 and 7 could partially overlap after summary generation, but sequential ensures dependency clarity.
orchestration.error_handling: If metadata extraction fails, fallback to meeting title and description for summarization; if objection generation fails, return summary only.

compositions.prompt_text: Prepare me for my meeting with our customer Beta tomorrow. Include a background on their company, create a dossier of who will attend and include their interests so I can have better conversations.

execution_plan.description: Parse the user prompt to extract intent: prepare for a customer meeting with Beta tomorrow, gather company background, attendee dossier, and interests.
execution_plan.note: Universal first step to interpret natural language and identify key requirements.

execution_plan.description: Retrieve all calendar events for tomorrow to locate the meeting with customer Beta.
Extract metadata for the identified meeting: attendees, RSVP status, meeting title, and any attached documents.
execution_plan.note: Required to build attendee dossier and understand meeting details.

execution_plan.description: Resolve attendee names from the meeting metadata to full directory profiles, including roles and contact details.
execution_plan.note: Needed to create a detailed dossier of attendees.

execution_plan.description: Gather background information on Beta (the customer company) and identify attendee interests based on past interactions and available data.
execution_plan.note: Critical for providing company background and personalized insights for better conversations.

execution_plan.description: Generate a structured briefing document (dossier) that includes company background, attendee profiles, and their interests.
execution_plan.note: Delivers the final output requested by the user: a comprehensive preparation document.

parallelization_opportunities: Steps 4 and 5 could partially overlap after metadata extraction, but sequential ensures data integrity.
orchestration.error_handling: If research data is incomplete, fallback to basic attendee and company info from internal sources; retry API calls for external data.
